metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25866 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 3.2.0 to 3.2.6 and 3.0.0 to 3.0.13, the BLIP protocol dissector has a NULL pointer dereference because a buffer was sized for compressed (not uncompressed) messages. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-blip.c by allowing reasonable compression ratios and rejecting ZIP bombs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.2.7-1
libwireshark16 - 3.2.7-1
libwiretap13 - 3.2.7-1
libwsutil14 - 3.2.7-1
tshark - 3.2.7-1
wireshark - 3.2.7-1
wireshark-common - 3.2.7-1
wireshark-qt - 3.2.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.7-1').
